Following last year's excellent Brutalist Jam map pack, Quake mappers have reunited to release another free load of levels inspired by Brutalism and concrete. The 30 maps offer good honest fragging in everything from concrete cities to murderous mystical puzzle boxes. Honestly, I'd recommend downloading the pack even if only to see the hub level and marvel at quite how good Quake can look when made for modern PCs.
Read more
articles.title: Quake goes Brutalist again in another free map pack celebrating concrete

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you're weary of Baldur's Gate 3's whimsy, or you've finished gnawing the bones of Diablo 4 and are hungry for more of that sweet, sweet grimdark, you might like to check out Beast from Polish developer False Prophet, which goes into Steam early access today. It's a turn-based tactics RPG with a Gothic historical setting, an extremely late-noughties insanity mechanic, a heavy metal soundtrack, plagues, heresy, dynastic feuding, and a protagonist with a dramatic eye scar and possibly non-metaphorical "inner demons". Amongst other things, it looks like you can run people over with a horse-drawn carriage. M-Rated enough for you, edgelords? Here's the trailer.

 
Read more
articles.title: Beast, out in early access today, is Baldur's Gate 3 meets Diablo 4 via Unreal Engine 5

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Cities: Skylines 2 developers Colossal Order and publisher Paradox Interactive have penned a letter to their community about the game's launch performance problems and other technical troubles, sharing details of forthcoming updates and smaller bug patches while also assuring players that "the issues are not deeply rooted in the game's foundation". The developers include a few thoughts about what performance means for a management sim like Skylines 2, revealing that they considered delaying release to improve and stabilise the game, but felt that postponing launch would be "unfair" to those who are less bothered by such things.

 
Read more
articles.title: Cities: Skylines 2 devs considered release delay to boost performance, but decided it's "not a dealbreaker"

articles.author: Julian Benson
articles.description:
“Not everyone is Nintendo,” Hilmar Veigar Pétursson says. “Corporate entities, historically, are not very long-living. By being 30 years old, CCP is old by company standards.” As we talk, his fixation on persistence and artefact becomes clear. Though, he’s never hidden it. In 2014, Pétursson’s company, CCP, unveiled a five-metre-tall sculpture with the names of every active player in their MMO, EVE Online, etched into its surface; this year, they expanded the monument to add the names of players who have subscribed in the decade since. “I've been obsessed about doing things like printed books, magazines, models of EVE Online...,” Pétursson tells me, “like there's this need to leave a footprint.” 



Pétursson has discovered a company that uses cow stem cells to 3D print calfskin. For the studio’s 30th anniversary, he plans to commission a poetry chapter inspired by Iceland’s epic history book, the Prose Edda, write it on the artificial skin, and put it in a Reykjavik museum. It would sit alongside an ancient calfskin copy of the Icelandic sagas. “It was written 1000 years ago, but as an Icelandic person, I can still read and understand what it says,” Pétursson explains. He tells me that it’s an effective way of storing data because if you sent a USB stick 1,000 years into the future, where would you even find a computer with a drive to read it? This appreciation for artefacts and need for legacy has led to his current project, a new game from CCP using blockchain technology, currently known as Project Awakening.

 
Read more
articles.title: Project Awakening is born from EVE Online’s fragility - so it's turning to the blockchain

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
American McGee has spent the past several years trying to make Alice: Asylum, a third entry in his series of action-horror games inspired by Lewis Carroll's Alice's Adventures in Wonderland. That fight produced a crowdfunded 414-page design bible but came to an end earlier this year when rights-holders EA rejected the pitch, and McGee declared that he had "no other ideas or energy left to apply toward getting a new Alice game made."

McGee reiterated similar sentiments in a new video discussing the project's end, but he did suggest one "ray of hope" to the community. "The design bible as produced is the perfect thing to feed into an AI system to have it completely build the game that is outlined in that design bible."

 
Read more
articles.title: American McGee says AI offers the only hope of a new Alice game

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
There have been a lot of junky Aliens games in recent years, but 2021's co-op shooter Aliens: Fireteam Elite is among the better bughunts. A new update released today fixes matchmaking errors, improves companion AI, and comes with news that its developers are working on a new game.

 
Read more
articles.title: Aliens: Fireteam Elite gets "long-requested quality of life updates" as developer starts work on new project

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Nightdive Studios have made a name for themselves by remastering numerous '90s classics, mostly first-person shooters. Next in line is their Star Wars: Dark Forces remaster, which was announced in August. Now it has a release date: February 28th, 2024.

 
Read more
articles.title: Nightdive's Star Wars: Dark Forces remaster will launch next February

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Rocksmith is Ubisoft's take on Guitar Hero, with the key difference being that you can play it with a real guitar. That makes it a good teaching tool as much as it is a game. Or made it a good teaching tool, anyway - Rocksmith 2014 has been removed from sale almost ten years to the day after it launched.

 
Read more
articles.title: Rocksmith 2014 has been removed from sale ten years after release, and its DLC will follow

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
Massive SATA SSDs are getting ever more affordable, and this is the best 4TB deal we've ever seen here at RPS. You can get a TeamGroup T-Force Vulcan Z 4TB drive for just $138 at Newegg, down from a previous price of $180. 
In fact, this is half the price of a deal we were eagerly posting about just one year ago, which really speaks to the speed at which SSD storage has collapsed in price in 2023. 
Read more
articles.title: Want a 4TB SSD for $138? This is a 4TB SSD for $138

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
LG's C2 OLED is my top TV recommendation for PC and console gaming, and the 42-inch and 48-inch versions can even work as PC monitors. Today the 48-inch model has dropped to £824 at Ebay when you use codes BONUS10 and SAVE100OLED, a great price for what is a class-leading 48-inch OLED. For context, this year's basically identical 48-inch C3 OLED costs £1100, so you're saving nearly £300. 
Read more
articles.title: LG's incredible 48-inch C2 OLED TV is down to £824 with a double discount at Ebay UK

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
A few weeks ago I wrote about Grand Theft Auto players describing the movement of planes in random GTA promotional art as evidence of a forthcoming GTA 6 reveal, timed to intersect with the waning gibbous moon. I thought that the furore might die down after GTA 6 failed to materialise in accordance with the lunar cycle, but it turns out this rabbit hole has no bottom.
Come now, gaze upon the above, just-posted Rockstar promotional image for a new Red Dead Online outfit. To my eye, that picture looks like a weird dude in a mask, gazing at you through piles of skulls. Standard Halloween gamer fare. But it turns out that when you draw lines on it using MS Paint, you end up with the below. 

 
Read more
articles.title: GTA 6 fans desperate for an October reveal are convinced Rockstar are trolling them

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
One of the most unnerving things about Geometric Interactive's lush insect puzzler Cocoon is how intuitive it feels. For my money, anyway. The premise is perfectly brain-bending: each world contains or is contained by another world, and you're a beetle who can not only leap between them, but pick one world up and use it as a puzzle prop inside another.
The game doesn't really verbalise any of this: there's no equivalent for Atreus in God Of War: Ragnarok, ostentatiously nudging you towards each solution. And yet somehow, I find myself flowing through Cocoon like I'm being poured out of a bottle, switching scales and putting together the pieces in a way that feels effortful yet graceful, earned yet... eerily frictionless. This is no reflection on my knack for solving puzzles. It's a show of how elegantly the game is made so that while there's difficulty, there's rarely frustration.
Read more
articles.title: The (miniature) making of Cocoon: how to make a complex puzzle game feel easy

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Puzzle game Suika, or 'That Watermelon Game', is currently having a bit of a moment online. It's been available on Switch for a couple of years now in Japan, but this week it received an English eShop version, and it's taken off a bit with streamers and Twitch folk. It's also spawned dozens of clones, including an unofficial free web browser version that I've been giving a go over the last couple of lunch times to see what all the fuss is about. It's a neat little time waster. It's a teensy bit different to the proper Switch version, but the basic concept is the same: it's a essentially physics-based fruit Tetris meets Threes, where you're dropping similar-looking fruits on top of one another to combine them into even larger fruits. 
The goal is to combine them enough times to get the big watermelon for mega points, but honestly, I'm not sure how much longer I can keep playing this free version of Suika, because so many of the fruits you meet along the way to the watermelon just look so gosh darn sad that it's breaking my heart a little. Then again, if I was a pear, I'd probably have a pretty sour-looking face, too, if I'm honest.
Read more
articles.title: I can't play watermelon game Suika's free PC clone anymore, because the fruits all look too goddamn sad

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
I like to-do list games. Take Wytchwood, where your to-do list is stuff like 'craft trap to catch lizard to use lizard eyes to craft weapon to defeat ghost to...' and so on. My Little Universe, which is clearly best played in co-op, and would be good to play with kids if you have sourced any of those from somewhere, is like a to-do list game that reduces crafting to the barest minimum. You are basically collecting raw resources and pouring them into a bottomless maw. Despite that description, it's quite charming.
Read more
articles.title: My Little Universe is like a crafting sim meets an idle clicker

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
Stretch and compress rooms to make your escape in Stretchmancer, a nice little puzzle-platformer you can play for free. Your heroic gecko is a Stretchmancer, see, able to bend the dimensions of spaces to push walls far away and draw distant objects near. This is handy when trying to defeat an evil space empire. Stretchmancer is in a similar vein to Portal: a first-person puzzle-platformer which uses one neat trick to change how you see the world, and builds on that while a baddie taunts you. It's short, it's free, it's fun, and you might enjoy it slightly breaking your eyes.
Read more
articles.title: Stretch reality to solve platforming puzzles in this fun little free game

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Cities: Skylines 2 is, much like the wonkily roaded, pollution-choked helltown I’ve built within it, a work in progress. Developers Colossal Order upped the citybuilding sequel’s system requirements well in advance of launch, and more recently admitted to have "not achieved the benchmark we targeted" for PC performance. Instead, future improvements are promised, to patch Skylines 2 into better shape.
I wish I could say that this is all just pessimism, born from an overabundance of caution and expectation management. But no, it is just a bit of a mess, one capable of putting freshly mixed concrete shoes on even the fastest graphics cards. I’ve worked out a best settings guide that, compared to the available graphics presets, can better balance performance and visuals – though be warned that this will feel more like urgent repair work than a dream remodel.
Read more
articles.title: Cities: Skylines 2 PC performance, system requirements, and the best settings to use

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Excellent news today, folks. The RPS guides team is once again back at full strength as we welcome two fresh faces to the Treehouse. Please give a big warm hello and welcome to Kiera Mills and Jeremy Blum. 
Read more
articles.title: Please welcome our new guides writers, Kiera Mills and Jeremy Blum

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Snake? Snake?! SNAAAAAAAAA - Oh, there you are, Snake. This is just a quick Codec to let you know that Konami's stealth blockbuster bundle Metal Gear Solid - Master Collection Volume 1 is now available to buy. Did you ever play Metal Gear Solid, Snake? It's this sprawling philosophical epic about war, surveillance, AI, nationalism and anti-heroism, a baroque metafictional saga spanning generations that is also a complex series of videogame design experiments. I know - it's a lot to take in, Snake, but you can sort of boil the series down to the difference between two varieties of wall. There are the ones you hide behind, so as to get the drop on your foes, and there are the ones you break, because they're fourth walls, Snake. Do you see?

 
Read more
articles.title: Metal Gear Solid - Master Collection Vol 1 is out, bringing MGS3 to PC for the first time

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The Elder Scrolls 6 is going to be a mixture of new ideas and RPG systems that go all the way back to The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion, according to Bethesda's former design director Bruce Nesmith, who was lead designer on The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim and senior designer on Starfield. In particular, Nesmith reckons it will "absolutely" continue with Skyrim's approach to levelling and progression, whereby you improved skills by performing the associated actions. He also thinks the game will "probably" retain elements of the magic system he designed for Skyrim, which broke away from Oblivion and Morrowind in being simpler to understand and more immediately powerful, at the price of flexibility and inventiveness.

 
Read more
articles.title: Elder Scrolls 6 will keep Skyrim's approach to levelling and "traces" of its magic, says former Starfield designer

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Final Fantasy XIV’s achievements are no joke, as proved by the 10 years it took the first player to earn every achievement in the MMO. But director and producer Naoki Yoshida is up for making even more difficult achievements, if the achievement-hunting pro is game for the challenge.

 
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy XIV will get even harder achievements, if the player who already earned all 2,700 of them asks for it

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Final Fantasy XIV’s latest Fan Festival took place in London over the weekend, running two days of panels with the MMO’s development team, its director Naoki ‘Yoshi-P’ Yoshida and legendary series creator Hironobu Sakaguchi. In-between announcing a new job for expansion Dawntrail, revealing anecdotes from the early days of Final Fantasy and a whole bunch of crossovers on the way, Yoshi-P and Sakaguchi found time to kick back with some very silly hijinks during the game’s boss battles.

 
Read more
articles.title: Watch Final Fantasy’s creator grief XIV director Yoshi-P, get crushed by iconic series bosses and poke a gigachad in the arse

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
More than three years after a TV adaptation of Fallout was first teased, we know when we’ll be able to watch the latest attempt to turn a video game into a live-action prestige series.

 
Read more
articles.title: Amazon’s Fallout TV show finally has a release date

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
I always love spotting deals on budget mechanical keyboards, as they bring what is - in my mind at least - the single biggest keyboard upgrade available to prices that you can't say no to. The LTC Neon75 is far from a big-brand choice, but the keyboard ticks all the boxes for me when it comes to features and design. There are beautiful 'pudding' keycaps, a compact and convenient 75% layout, tri-mode wired/wireless connectivity and hot-swappable key switches. Its US MSRP is a reasonable-sounding $70, but now it's available for a 50% off 'overstock' price on Amazon - that's just $35. 
Read more
articles.title: This compact mechanical keyboard is 50% off at Amazon US, just $35 for 84 keys

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Hugely popular K-pop group Le Sserafim are headed to Overwatch 2 in the shooter’s first crossover with a music artist. The collab is more than just skins, too - expect a whole new game mode based on the band. And yes, there’ll be cosmetic items too, of course.

 
Read more
articles.title: Overwatch 2 takes a leaf from Fortnite’s book of music megastars as it teams up with K-pop giants Le Sserafim

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
When I was a kid I sort of hated Frasier. It was one of those shows you’d find in the 6pm slot on terrestrial TV, back when you had to show up for TV episodes on time or miss them forever, and as far as 10-year-old me was concerned, 6pm was Simpsons hour. Who was this strutting Seattle intellectual, with his glass of sherry and his call-in psychiatry show and his passion for silverware?
I couldn’t abide Frasier and developed a pathological aversion to headliner (and surprisingly convincing X-Man) Kelsey Grammer – but that was before The Simpsons spoofed Frasier and showed me the error of my ways. I still wouldn’t say I’m an outright Frasier fan - or Frasien, as they prefer to be known. Some of the humour is kind of eeesh, in hindsight. But I’ve experienced and enjoyed enough to find Edward La Barbera’s Fraiser Fantasy pretty funny.

 
Read more
articles.title: Frasier Fantasy is a free RPG homage to the snobby 90s sitcom

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Hexworks are making some pretty comprehensive adjustments to fantasy Soulslike RPG Lords of the Fallen, rejigging the AI so that enemies won't pursue you quite as far when you run past them, and patching how the New Game Plus options work to give players more control over the difficulty curve. The game's latest patch, out now, allows you to choose whether to progress to a harder NG+ setting after finishing a run, or restart at the same difficulty threshold while retaining your character and progression. 


"This will allow trophy hunters and completionists to seek out any outstanding tasks without having to contend with increased difficulty, should they so choose," the developers say in Lords of the Fallen's latest patch notes. And these are just the first of "some fundamental changes to ensure everyone continues to enjoy the NG+ experience", according to Hexworks. Heft that magic lantern and read on.

 
Read more
articles.title: New Lords of the Fallen updates make sweeping, transformative changes to New Game+

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
Last week we recommended one of LG's 27-inch Fast IPS monitors at the popular 1440p 144Hz spec point, and now we're back to look at one better: a 1440p 240Hz model that's going for $350 via LG's US web store or Amazon's US storefront if you prefer. 
Read more
articles.title: This 1440p 240Hz LG monitor is down to $350 in the US

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
As Rare famously discovered back in the 90s, if you stick a pair of eyes on an inanimate object, it immediately becomes the most adorable thing you've ever seen in your life. Take Subpar Pool's cue ball. What could have been just a straightforward mash-up of pool meets golf is suddenly given a new lease of life, warmth, charm and character, just because it has little eyes and a dumb, goofy smile plastered on its face. Some of its 'Chonker'-sized pool balls even have coiffed miniature moustaches for crying out loud, and they all babble cute nonsense noises at you as you ping them around its procedurally generated boards; hrnnnnngh they're just so gosh darn endearing that I simply cannot help myself. They make Subpar Pool a very easy game to like, which is precisely why it's so heartbreaking I can't quite bring myself to love it in the same way I do Grapefrukt Games' previous puzzle game, Holedown.
Read more
articles.title: Subpar Pool review: the most charming pool-golf you'll ever play, but not quite a hole(down) in one

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you've been looking at the current crop of Silent Hill sequels, remakes and remasters and pining for the foggy streets and busted doorknobs of yesteryear, I recommend trying the demo for Heartworm. This is survival horror just the way Mother used to make it - before Mother read all those forbidden books and decided to sacrifice you to Samael, Lord of Serpents and Reeds. You've got your 3D engine with fixed camera perspectives, your thick coating of TV static, your sluggish vehicular control scheme, your enemies that could be either demons or metaphors and will murder you either way. 


There's a big dollop of Resident Evil here, too, and a gentler dusting of Fatal Frame. The main character is driven by grief, sports a fiesty tank-and-shorts combo, and is equipped with a flash camcorder for exorcising spooks rather than a firearm. In other words, she's the point on the Venn diagram between Jill Valentine, Miku Hinasaki and Harry Mason. The individual camera choices are more Evil than Hilly: the game frequently switches to a close-up face-on perspective when you enter a room, forcing you to step into the blindspot. That endless inter-dimensional staircase, though? Pure Team Silent. Other influences include Half-Life, Puppet Combo and Donnie Darko.


I'm pretty sold on Heartworm, though I'm still waiting for it to spark its own identity from all those grated-together shards of older horror games. So it's a bit sad that the project is in enormous trouble.
 
Read more
articles.title: One of the most promising Silent Hill clones is in serious trouble

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
I know some things aren't for me: The sitcom Friends, a small bowl exclusively filled with olives as a side dish, V-neck t-shirts. But I appreciate that while I might not get on with them, many others will enjoy the bite of an olive on its own, or the increased airflow to their larynx as they chortle at Joey doing the silly thing he does at Rachel, or whatever. Ghostrunner 2, a first-person cyberpunk slasher and sequel to Ghostrunner, has joined the echelon of things that aren't for me but might be for you.
That's because the game's relentlessly unforgiving, and sets margins so small you're rarely afforded much freedom. Sometimes it really does put you in the RGB kicks of a cyber ninja as you dash between the halves of cyborgs you've cleaved in two, but these moments can often be the weary culmination of agonising trial and error. If you're into that, great! If you're not, then I'd slink back into that shadow.
Read more
articles.title: Ghostrunner 2 review: an unforgiving cyberpunk slasher you'll either love or despise

articles.author: Jai Singh Bains
articles.description:
Everybody knows some version of the story around Final Fantasy XIV: it came out, it wasn’t very good, it was remade as A Realm Reborn, and now it’s beloved. Over the decade since A Realm Reborn’s release, its reputation has grown with every single expansion. FFXIV’s producer and director Naoki Yoshida (more commonly known as Yoshi P) is now so synonymous with the game that it’s easy to forget he was only brought onto the project in 2010 - after XIV had been released, to overwhelmingly negative reviews.

 
Read more
articles.title: Why Final Fantasy XIV failed, and how it recovered

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
Every weekend, indie devs show off current work on Twitter's #screenshotsaturday tag. And every Monday, I bring you a selection of these snaps and clips. This week, my eye has been caught by Moebius-styled violence, a big bat, a Devil Daggers demake, a miniature mech, and heaps more. Check out all these attractive and interesting indie games!
Read more
articles.title: Screenshot Saturday Mondays: More Moebius and a big bat battle

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
2023's mass eradication of the games industry continues with reports of layoffs at Sony Interactive Entertainment and PlayStation Studios. It's unclear how extensive these losses are - Sony have yet to provide comment, at the time of writing - but they appear to include staff at PlayStation's Visual Arts studio, based in San Diego, which supports developers like The Last of Us creators Naughty Dog and Spider-Man 2 creators Insomniac.

 
Read more
articles.title: "Wave of layoffs" at PlayStation reported by developer of unannounced game

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
It's been 11 long years since the unveiling of Squadron 42, Star Citizen's singleplayer campaign, seven years since developer Cloud Imperium Games broke Squadron 42 off into a standalone purchase, five years since Crytek took them to court for allegedly breaching their CryEngine license, three years since Crytek and Cloud Imperium settled that lawsuit, and three years since director Chris Roberts sought to justify the game's mammoth development time to Kickstarter backers, declaring that "it would be doing a huge disservice to everyone working really hard on the project and all of you that are looking forward to it to deliver something that isn't great." Well, all that waiting has finally paid off, as Squadron 42 is now officially... "feature-complete" and "into the polishing phase", meaning that the Wing Commander-inspired space sim is almost guaranteed to release before the death of our sun.


Cloud Imperium have released a new trailer walkthrough to celebrate, which does admittedly look spaceworthy. It's a whistle-stop tour of Squadron 42 gameplay and story materials - from dogfights in asteroid belts that use a new precision targeting feature, through "OMG my CO is Gillian Anderson" cinematics, to physics-based puzzling malarkey involving a Half-Life Gravity Gun-adjacent gizmo. If I were, say, Starfield developer Bethesda, I'd be particularly worried about those planetary surface flyovers. Mind you, by the time Squadron 42 launches we'll probably be playing Starfield 2. I kid, Roberts, I kid!

 
Read more
articles.title: Space sim Squadron 42 is "feature-complete" and gunning for Starfield's lunch with massive new video

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Sundays are for washing your headphone earcups. Before you rinse thoroughly, let's read this week's best writing about games (and game related things).
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
The director of Final Fantasy XIV has said he’d love to channel the chaos and freedom of nineties MMO godparent Ultima Online into his own game - but it couldn’t be FF14 itself, as the unbridled chaos would ‘break’ its players.

 
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy XIV’s Yoshi-P would like to make an MMO as chaotic and free as Ultima Online, but it would break FF14

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Final Fantasy 14’s 7.0 update won’t hit the MMO for almost another year, arriving alongside the game’s next expansion Dawntrail in the summer of 2024. Director Naoki Yoshida already has some plans for the next two major updates after that, though - but he’d really rather you didn’t ask about them.

 
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy 14’s 7.0 update isn’t out until next summer, but its director already has plans for 8.0 and 9.0

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Final Fantasy 14 has crossed over with everything from Monster Hunter and Nier to Yokai Watch and Fall Guys. But there’s one video game crossover that remains at the top of director-producer Naoki Yoshida’s list: Diablo.

 
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy 14 director would still love to do a Diablo crossover, please

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
80 Days, Heaven's Vault and the Sorcery! games were all created by Inkle using their own scripting language, called Ink. It's a powerful tool for creating game narrative using simple markup rather than code, and it's open source so it can be used by other developers.

One drawback thus far has been that there was no native integration with the Unreal engine. That has now changed thanks to a new open source plug-in created by The Chinese Room.

 
Read more
articles.title: The scripting language powering some of the best written games now works with Unreal engine

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Football Manager 2024 launches on November 6th, but it's available now for those who pre-order. As always, the "Advanced Access" offers the full game, albeit with a higher chance of encountering bugs.

 
Read more
articles.title: Football Manager 2024's advanced access is available now

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Alan Wake 2 is out in a little under a week, and Remedy have just announced its PC system requirements. Things I learned: I probably can't play Alan Wake 2.

 
Read more
articles.title: Alan Wake 2's PC system requirements are hefty, with an RTX2060 minimum

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Final Fantasy creator Hironobu Sakaguchi originally turned down the roleplaying game’s now-iconic soundtrack by Nobuo Uematsu - until the legendary composer simply changed the track order, that is.

 
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy creator originally rejected all of the music by the series’ legendary composer Nobuo Uematsu

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Final Fantasy 14’s crossover with Fall Guys looks as gloriously chaotic as the original mean bean gauntlet - and it’s out very soon. The incoming minigame playable inside the MMO will see 24 Warriors of Light race across Fall Guys courses given a Final Fantasy-themed twist.

 
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy 14’s Fall Guys minigame looks like wonderful chaos, and we’ll be able to play it this month

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Final Fantasy XIV has revealed the first of two new jobs coming to the MMO in next year’s expansion Dawntrail. The Viper is a fast-paced melee DPS armed with two swords that can transform, Bloodborne-style, into a single two-handed weapon. It’s brand new for the Final Fantasy series, too.

 
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy 14’s new Viper job is a dual-wielding blademaster that’s new to the entire series

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Final Fantasy XIV is once again dipping into the rest of the storied series in a new series of raids and quests for the MMO.

 
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy 14 is getting FFXI raids for the MMO’s 20th anniversary and a FFXVI quest crossover - complete with a Torgal mount

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: ALEF-CSIRT)
articles.description: Dnes bude řeč o útoku na Michiganskou univerzitu, chybě v prohlížeči Safari, nové funkci Google Chrome, programech na bughunting na platfromě HackerOne a smutném rekordu měsíce září.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: lov zranitelností se vyplatí

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Byl zveřejněn plán vydání Ubuntu 24.04 LTS „Noble Numbat“. Z důvodu dvou objevených problémů bylo vydání Fedory 39 odsunuto o týden. Netgate přestal nabízet pfSense Home+Lab kvůli neoprávněnému šíření.
articles.title: Plán vydání Ubuntu 24.04, vydání Fedory 39 odloženo

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Konference OpenAlt oslaví 18. narozeniny. Nové poznatky načerpáte od známých i zcela nových přednášejících. Přijeďte na konferenci OpenAlt, která proběhne o víkendu 11. a 12. listopadu v Brně na FI MU.
articles.title: OpenAlt 2023: otevřený software i společnost, bezpečnost, vzdělávání

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Canoeboot je další fork Coreboot/Libreboot, AMD vydává ray-tracing knihovnu HIP RT 2.1, oprava pro notebooky Lenovo v Linuxu 6.6, KDE s autentizací skrze otisk prstu a smartcard.
articles.title: GPU Intel s Tile-Based renderingem, KDE se správou barev na Waylandu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Klasické rotační pevné disky se stále prodávají a mají čile k světu, ale kupují je ještě běžní smrtelníci? Možná se mnou ne všichni budou souhlasit, ale: nejsme už definitivně v post-mechanické éře?
articles.title: SSD neustále zlevňují, terabajt stojí tisícovku a nespolehlivosti se bát nemusíte

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Satrapa)
articles.description: Není server jako server a v DNS to platí dvojnásob. V hierarchii domén existuje několik různých typů serverů, jejichž role se významně liší. Vysvětlíme si, za co který zodpovídá a jak pracuje.
articles.title: Principy fungování DNS: role různých typů serverů při řešení dotazů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: S projektem Transcrypt popsaným na začátku týdne je velmi úzce spojen projekt nazvaný Numscrypt (Nµmscrλpt). Jedná se o částečnou portaci známé knihovny Numpy do JavaScriptu, takže funkce z Numpy je možné využít v pythonních skriptech.
articles.title: Numscrypt aneb Numpy běžící ve webovém prohlížeči

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Macek)
articles.description: Ať chcete nebo ne, časem se šestce nevyhnete. Internet ji potřebuje pro další rozvoj a po celém světě ji už využívá téměř polovina uživatelů, aniž to tuší. Není to složité, ukážeme si pár příkladů.
articles.title: Základy nasazení IPv6: od získání adres až po síť pro hosty

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si odemkneme zaheslované PDF dokumenty, vyzkoušíme šikovného správce souborů, shlédneme pár seriálů a integrujeme si AppImage do systému.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (25. 10. 2023): odemkněte PDF chráněné heslem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: V dnešním článku se seznámíme s nástrojem Transcrypt, což je další překladač (přesněji řečeno transpřekladač – transpiler) zdrojových kódů z Pythonu do JavaScriptu. Nabízí i celou řadu funkcí ze standardní knihovny Pythonu.
articles.title: Transcrypt: technologie umožňující použití Pythonu v prohlížeči

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na serveru GOG.com pokračují Halloweenské slevy a je možné získat zdarma hru The Whisperer. Jde o hororovou klikací adventuru z Kanady na začátku 19. století.
articles.title: Hra zdarma na GOG.com: The Whisperer

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Firefox Nightly je denně kompilovaný experimentální kód, který se časem stane betou a poté oficiálním Firefoxem. Mozilla vydává pravidelně binárky Nightly jako soubory tar.bz2. Teď nově vytvořila také APT repozitář, aby usnadnila testování na Debianu a Ubuntu.
articles.title: Mozilla má APT repozitář pro Firefox Nightly

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Tomáš Heřmánek)
articles.description: Naučte se nainstalovat a provést základní nastavení bezpečnostní platformy Wahuz 4.5. Ve středu 1. listopadu od 10:00 do 12:00 vás celým procesem na bezplatném webináři provede zkušený lektor Miroslav Chládek.
articles.title: Webinář Wazuh 4.5: Instalace a konfigurace

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Jak jsme již psali, v jádře 6.7 se objeví parametr ia32_emulation, kterým půjde vypnout 32bitová volání pro x86. V současnosti je možné podporu 32bitů zapnout a vypnout pouze při kompilaci ( IA32_EMULATION) a zároveň téměř všechna distribuční jádra ji mají zapnutou.
articles.title: V jádře 6.7 půjde vypnout 32bitová volání pro x86

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Dnes časně ráno vydal Linus Torvalds jádro 6.6. Mezi hlavní novinky patří plánovač EEVDF (Earliest Eligible Virtual Deadline First), který nahradí stávající CFS (Completely Fair Scheduler).
articles.title: Vyšlo jádro 6.6 s novým plánovačem EEVDF

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Kubernetes je dnes nejrozšířenější platformou na hostovaní Docker kontejnerů a je podporován velkými hráči na trhu (Google, Amazon, Microsoft) skrz Cloud Native Computing Foundation. Kuberneres pro provoz používají všechny velikosti firem, od startupu po korporace. Pojďme se naučit jej používat na dvoudenním kurzu Úvod do Kubernetes, který proběhne v naší pražské školicí místnosti ve dnech 13. a 14. listopadu. Školení proběhne v naší pražské školicí místnosti a můžete se ho zúčastnit i online.
articles.title: Naučte se Kubernetes na našem dvoudenním školení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: srnec)
articles.description: Menovaní výrobcovia zablokovali telefóny dovezené mimo oficiálnych kanálov. Najaktívnejší v tomto bol Samsung ktorý si zobral aj „rukojemníkov“ v podobe dát používateľov. Zasiahla vláda dotknutej krajiny, odvolávajúca sa na občianske a spotrebiteľské práva.
articles.title: Samsung, Motorola a ZTE blokujú Mexičanom telefóny zo šedého importu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na GOG.com právě probíhají Halloweenské slevy a při té příležitosti můžete získat hru Blacksad: Under the Skin zdarma. Hra je detektivní adventura ve které hrajete kočičího soukromého detektiva Johna Blacksada a vyšetřujete úplatkářskou aféru v New Yorku.
articles.title: Hra na GOG.com zdarama: Blacksad: Under the Skin

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Fedora 39 měla vyjít 18. října, ale včera bylo rozhodnuto, že bude vydání odloženo nejméně do 7. listopadu. Důvodem jsou problémy se startem na Raspberry Pi 4. Jedním z nich je, že U-Boot nečte DTB soubory z adresáře /boot a druhým nefunkční boot z SD karty.
articles.title: Fedora 39 opožděna nejméně do 7. listopadu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Open-source webmail Roundcube obsahuje zranitelnost CVE-2023–5631 XSS (cross-site scripting). Útok se spustí pouhým prohlédnutím útočníkova e-mailu a útočník může spustit libovolný JS kód, například si může nechat přeposlat veškerou komunikaci.
articles.title: Závažná XSS zranitelnost webmailu Roundcube

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Cloudflare ve čtvrtek zveřejnil zprávu za třetí čtvrtletí letošního roku. V něm zachytilo 89 velkých HTTP DDoS útoků o síle více než 100 miliónů RPS (requests per second). Rekordní DDoS útok měl 201 Mrps. Předchozí rekord byl jen 71 Mrps.
articles.title: Rekordní DDoS útok 201 miliónů RPS zneužívající HTTP/2 Rapid Reset

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Na internetu píšou, že začít s automatizací správy serverů můžete do půl hodiny. Dokážeme vám, že s Ansible to je pravda. Stačí navštívit naše pražské školení Ansible – úvod do automatizace a pak navazující Ansible – role a AWX.
articles.title: Ansible: úvod do automatizace, role a AWX (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Ubuntu 24.04 LTS bude mít kódové jméno „Noble Numbat“ (vznešený mravencojed). Mravencojed je australský vačnatec, který se živí termity.
articles.title: Ubuntu 24.04 bude Noble Numbat

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Atom)
articles.description: Už za tři týdny proběhne další ročník akce OSFF Hackathon 2023. Hackathon se bude pořádat v Něměcku ve městě Bochum. Začíná 17. listopadu ve 14 hodin a potrvá celý víkend až do neděle.
articles.title: Coreboot hackathon 2023 už za tři týdny

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Linuxová jádra máme s dlouhou podporou LTS (Long-Term Support), ale v současnosti se diskutuje zkrácení této podpory ze 6 na 2 roky. LTS jsou v současnosti 4.14 (jen do ledna 2024), 4.19 (do prosince 2024), 5.4 (prosinec 2025), 5.10 (prosinec 2026), 5.15 (říjen 2026) a 6.1 (prosinec 2026).
articles.title: Jádra Super Long-Term Support s podporou 10 let

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V úterý v USA podalo 41 státních zástupců hromadnou žalobu na společnost Meta pro klamavé a neférové praktiky Instagramu a Facebooku, které poškozují děti a způsobují závislost. Podle průzkumů stačí hodina denně na sociálních sítích a u dětí a dospívajících se objevuje strmý nárůst depresí i jiných psychických problémů.
articles.title: Hromadná žaloba v USA na Meta kvůli závislosti dětí na Instagramu a Facebooku

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Výzkumníci z universit v Atlantě, Michiganu a Bochumi objevili zranitelnost postranním kanálem v procesorech Apple ARM (iPhone, iPad, nové Macy). Zranitelnost je podobná Spectre na x86 a je demonstrována vzdáleným získáním privátních dat přes prohlížeč Safari.
articles.title: iLeakage: zranitelnost postranním kanálem na Apple ARM a Safari

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Knihovnu zlib používá ke kompresi dat velké množství  programů a najdeme ji snad v každém systému. Zlib používá algoritmus DEFLATE, stejně jako gzip nebo zip. Knihovna zlib-ng  (next-generation) je moderní, rychlou a kompatibilní náhradou se stejným API. Oproti zlib používá rychlejší algoritmus DEFLATE od Intelu a Cloudflare, dále pak SIMD instrukce procesorů x86, ARM, IBM Z a POWER9. Ve výsledku je komprese asi 5× rychlejší a dekomprese asi 2,5×.
articles.title: Fedora 40 možná přejde od zlib na zlib-ng

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Jak X.Org Server, tak XWayland mají nové dílčí aktualizace, které řeší opravy tří nalezených zranitelností. Jde o další balíček chyb, které se v X.Org objevily po dvou chybách v X11 sahajících až do roku 1988.
articles.title: Nové verze XWayland a X.Org Server řeší tři bezpečnostní chyby

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nejnovější verze balíku Vulkan ovladače od AMD, tedy AMDVLK ve verzi 2023.Q4.1, už neobsahuje podporu pro staré Radeony generací Polaris a Vega. Modely jako Radeon RX 480 (rok 2016) či Vega 56 a Vega 64 (rok 2017) tak už nemohou s touto verzí využívat API Vulkan. Uživatelé tak buď musejí setrvat na starší verzi AMDVLK 2023.Q3, nebo sáhnout po Mesa RADV.
articles.title: AMDVLK 2023.Q4.1 už bez podpory Radeonů generací Vega a Polaris

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Oliver Fourdan z Red Hatu se blíže na svém blogu rozepsal o pokroku v tzv. Rootful módu XWaylandu. Ten od vydání letošní verze XWayland 23.1 přináší zlepšení v podpoře nastavení geometrie / rozlišení vnořeného X11 serveru, volitelnou integraci knihovny libdecor pro poskytování titulků oken či jejich dekorací. XWayland 23.2+ zase přináší dynamicky měnitelnou velikost těchto rootful oken.
articles.title: XWayland s Rootful Mode přináší lepší podporu běhu X11

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Štrobl)
articles.description: Pokud vyvíjíte svůj vlastní software a váš kód není jen oku lahodící, stavte se na dalším meetupu Cloud Native Prague. Dalším tématem je Continuous Integration, kde si povíme, jak automaticky sestavovat balíky vašich aplikací a probereme některé z technologií, které se v dnešní době používají. Nikdo přece jen nechce zbytečně čekat, než bude mít k dispozici balík pro nasazení na produkci. Samozřejmě otestovaný, že?
articles.title: Cloud Native Prague #6: jak na Continuous Integration

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Terraform vám umožní spravovat infrastrukturu jako kód, to znamená verzovanou v Gitu, přidávání zdrojů pomocí merge (pull) requestů a mnoho dalších výhod. Ukážeme si, jak Terraform pracuje, jak jej používat v týmu a jak jím spravovat infrastrukturu.
articles.title: Terraform: spravujte infrastrukturu jako kód (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Raptor Lake Refresh, neboli 14 generaci Intel Core, máme úspěšně na světě, ač za moc nestojí. Po ní přijde 15. generace Arrow Lake (notebooky ještě stihnou mezigeneraci Meteor Lake, ta ale pro desktopy nebude uvedena) a právě pro ni Intel začíná připravovat podporu všech potřebných částí, včetně podpory hardwarové akcelerace videa.

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vlastně už jsme si skoro zvykli, takže nejnovější informace od Canonicalu není šokem: firma i nadále hodlá držet tradici posledních LTS vydání Ubuntu Linuxu, kdy právě LTS vydání mají a nadále budou mít podporu 10 let.

articles.description: Zákazník nechce čekat, až si na něj operátor udělá čas. Nová data Salesforce ukazují „superuživatele“ umělé inteligence. Proč potřebujeme demokratizaci inovací? Veeam představil nové bezpečnostní funkce a pokročilou detekci malwaru. Osvědčené postupy při protokolování cloudu. Analýza: Technické podmínky k rychlému zavedení AI má v ČR téměř polovina firem.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Geopolitika mění trh s čipy, podíl Tchaj-wanu podle IDC klesne. Infor uvádí nové verze svých odvětvově specifických řešení CloudSuite. Amazon rozvíjí služby umělé inteligence: rozhraní Bedrock je nyní všeobecně dostupné, firma nabízí i další novinky. Absencí energetického managementu přicházejí tuzemské firmy ročně o stovky tisíc korun. Zmrazená část kvantového počítače může komunikovat bezdrátově. Řešení pro generativní umělou inteligenci od Dell Technologies urychlují podnikovou transformaci.

Skutečně můžete dostat vysoké slevy na pravé Windows 10 a Microsoft Office s doživotní licencí, když nenakoupíte přímo u Microsoftu, ale místo toho zamíříte na Goodoffer24. Vážně, jen si zkontrolujte neskutečné ceny, pokud upgradujete váš ekosystém s Windows.

articles.description: While the original AMD Navi GPUs featured Next-Gen Geometry (NGG) support, it was borked for some GPUs and initially didn't work out quite as well as planned for vertex and geometry processing. The Mesa Radeon Vulkan driver "RADV" has worked on the NGG code for years and with RDNA3 GPUs it's finally been working out very well from the start and better than their legacy pipeline. All the while the RDNA1/RDNA2 experimental NGG stream-out support has continued to exist but hidden behind a feature/debug flag. That code is now being removed...
